qas.question: What do present day Dominican Order associates do?

answers.text: share the mission and charism of the Dominican Family

qas.question: What is an example of a modern Dominican Order follower?
What draws many people into following the Dominican Order?
Present day members continue to do what for the Dominican Order?

answers.text: to praise, to bless, to preach

plausible_answers.text: share the mission and charism of the Dominican Family

qas.question: What do present day Benedictine Order associates do?
What is there not a growing number of?
Who does not share the Dominican charism?
What is not an example of a modern Dominican Order follower?
What do present day members continue to do for the Dominican Order?

context: Today, there is a growing number of <b5_0><b6_0>Associates<b6_0/><b5_0/> who share the Dominican <a2_0>charism<a2_0/>. Dominican Associates are <a1_0><b7_0>Christian women and men<a1_0/>;<b7_0/> married, single, divorced, and widowed; clergy members and lay persons who were first drawn to and then called to live out the charism and continue the mission of the Dominican Order - <a3_0>to <b8_0>praise, to bless, to preach<b8_0/><a3_0/>. Associates do not take vows, but rather make a commitment to be partners with vowed members, and to <a0_0><b4_0>share the mission and charism of the Dominican Family<b4_0/><a0_0/> in their own lives, families, churches, neighborhoods, workplaces, and cities.
